intro: Cuphea pseudosilene, commonly known as the red flame cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Lythraceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as poinsettias and crape myrtles. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. Its foliage is typically green with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Cuphea pseudosilene is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various growing conditions.
